CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Security Checks relative to Documentation Errors?
SRP.A: Security Checks is {above} Documentation Errors in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Customs Clearance relative to Sanitary Inspections?
SRP.A: Customs Clearance is {above} Sanitary Inspections in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Security Checks relative to Sanitary Inspections?
SRP.A: Security Checks is {above} Sanitary Inspections in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total cross-border delays?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Sanitary Inspections}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total cross-border delays?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Tariff Negotiations}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Tariff Negotiations's maximum Cross-Border Delays in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Tariff Negotiations's maximum Cross-Border Delays is in {2021}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Documentation Errors's maximum Cross-Border Delays in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Documentation Errors's maximum Cross-Border Delays is in {2020}.

NC.Q: Was the total Cross-Border Delays in 2010 higher or lower than in 2014?
NC.A: The total cross-border delays in 2010 was {higher} than in 2014.

NC.Q: Was the total Cross-Border Delays in 2020 higher or lower than in 2021?
NC.A: The total cross-border delays in 2020 was {higher} than in 2021.

NC.Q: Was the total Cross-Border Delays in 2010 higher or lower than in 2013?
NC.A: The total cross-border delays in 2010 was {higher} than in 2013.

NC.Q: Was the total Cross-Border Delays in 2013 higher or lower than in 2017?
NC.A: The total cross-border delays in 2013 was {lower} than in 2017.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Sanitary Inspections} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Customs Clearance and Political Disruptions first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Customs Clearance and Political Disruptions first exchanged leading positions in {2011}.
